videoData.title: The hardest step in innovation? Looking foolish in front of the crowd
videoData.socialTitle: The hardest step in innovation? Looking foolish in front of the crowd

nodes.whoTheyAre: Starting in 2003, Jack Levis led the development of ORION, an optimized routing system that's systematically transforming how UPS drivers do their jobs. As the senior director of process management at UPS, Levis considers how a massive company can use radical technologies to improve operations on a grand scale. By developing a routing system that determines the most efficient delivery route for every driver, Levis and his team will take more than 100 million miles off the road every year.

videoData.description: Innovation doesn't just take a great idea. It requires persistence and a thick skin. Jack Levis led the four-year long development of ORION, a system that determines the most efficient delivery route for UPS drivers and has been called the world's largest operation research project. At the center of a movement (and a department) that fundamentally challenges the status quo, Jack explores how we can persist – when everyone around us says, 'stop'.
